text: Remember the national emergency?
author: IsaacDovere

text: Walter Lippman and Daniel Boorstin knew more about contemporary politics than most of us who are living through it
author: IsaacDovere

text: "Sirota acknowledged kicking around some themes and ideas for speeches with Sanders, including some points that made it into speeches Sanders delivered, but rejected any suggestion he'd been doing anything more than talking"
author: IsaacDovere

text: Hickenlooper trolling O’Rourke:
author: IsaacDovere

text: Reminder that not only is Twitter not real life, but cable news also isn’t real life
author: IsaacDovere

text: The man Bernie Sanders had helping him write his speech about working on racial justice as a young man began his own career helping make a bogus website that tried to smear a black candidate with a race-based attack
author: IsaacDovere

text: Some politicians have charisma, some don’t. But the idea of “relatability” is deeply influenced by how relatable journalists covering find that candidate to be—so almost by definition, how much those journalists have in common with whichever candidate, in demographics and more
author: IsaacDovere

text:
Pelosi has seemed to be hard against impeachment. But this is what she told me back in November, right after the midterms:
“Recognize one point: What Mueller might not think is indictable could be impeachable.”
author: IsaacDovere

text: The Mueller investigation seems like it’s gone on forever - he’s been working for well under two years. Time between the Watergate break-in and Nixon’s resignation was two years and two months.
author: IsaacDovere

text:
The Sanders campaign ignored requests for comment on hiring (for the second time) a person fired for making a fake campaign website about a black candidate highlighting a misrepresented quote: 
“The black and the brown, if we unite, we’re going to control this city.”
author: IsaacDovere

text:
Sirota was fired from his job as deputy campaign manager in February 1999, with the candidate saying, "I do not want this race to be about race."

He was on staff for Sanders as press secretary that fall. 

https://www.theatlantic.com/politics/archive/2019/03/bernie-sanderss-new-speechwriter-has-controversial-past/585547/ …
author: IsaacDovere

text:
Sirota never acknowledged when he was fired for helping create a fake website using an out of context, racially-motivated quote to hit a black candidate. 

He did to me when I contacted him earlier today: 
“I am absolutely ashamed that it happened."
https://www.theatlantic.com/politics/archive/2019/03/bernie-sanderss-new-speechwriter-has-controversial-past/585547/ …
author: IsaacDovere

text:
here's some NEWS: @davidsirota, @BernieSanders new speechwriter, got fired from a 1999 Philly campaign for a racially charged “dirty trick” before he first went to work for Sanders in the House. Jeff Weaver, now Sanders' senior adviser, hired Sirota then.
https://www.theatlantic.com/politics/archive/2019/03/bernie-sanderss-new-speechwriter-has-controversial-past/585547/ …
author: IsaacDovere

text: while you wonder where the Mueller report is, here's a video of @Schwarzenegger in a cowboy hat, riding a bike around with a mini-horse:
author: IsaacDovere

text:
In 2015, Biden team’s pick an early VP idea was focused on E Warren. 
In 2017, it was focused on Kamala Harris. 
Now it is focused on Stacey Abrams, who if offered, would have to gamble her own future in GA politics against a hope that serving as Biden’s buffer would win the WH.
author: IsaacDovere

text: Biden himself has told people over the last year that it seems that way to him too
author: IsaacDovere

text: And Biden himself is in the same place about this one-term/pick a running mate early idea as he was when I reported this last March: he doesn’t like being thought of as old, or going in as a lame duck
author: IsaacDovere

text: A year ago, Biden and his team were at the same place worrying about his age and trying to mitigate it: https://www.politico.com/story/2018/03/09/joe-biden-trump-2020-448222 … as they are now: https://www.nytimes.com/2019/03/21/us/politics/biden-2020-vice-president.html …
author: IsaacDovere

text:
spokesperson for The Guardian told me that Sirota told the paper in Jan he was interested in working for Sanders.

Publisher of Capital & Main, Sirota’s precious main job, told @farhip Sirota told him of interest in working for Sanders 2nd week of Feb.
author: IsaacDovere

text: .@AndrewGillum to @AsteadWesley on why he's *not* joining the 2020 field - but what he thinks about the people who are (and the potentially game changing political project he's leading instead of running):
author: IsaacDovere

text: People have been asking about the timestamp in the screenshot here. I removed a timestamp of “8h”--irrelevant as only indicated when screenshot happened. Didn’t want to leave impression the tweet was more recent than it was, when in fact it went 12/27. Hope this clarifies things.
author: IsaacDovere

text:
.@Schwarzenegger to @PeterAtlantic on Trump’s attacks on McCain:
“The president should lift people up, should lift the nation up rather than always tearing people down.”

“I know he must be working out every day because he’s so unbelievably in shape.”
author: IsaacDovere

text: pretty great examination of Alex Jones’ supposed origin story by @jonronson up here
author: IsaacDovere

text: here’s Biden in front of the house he grew up in, in Scranton - while there in August 2016 on his trip to town to endorse Clinton, and then show her the house. It’s a quiet neighborhood of small houses.
author: IsaacDovere

text: The Scranton neighborhood where Biden grew up is not a place where anyone would likely recognize who Mark Putnam is, or think to send news of that spotting to a DC email newsletter, which means this, via @playbookplus is more likely... a deliberate leak:
author: IsaacDovere

text: Another 2020 Democrat (who was also a 2008 Democrat, when he didn’t compete in Iowa and got 402 votes in New Hampshire) emerges:
author: IsaacDovere

text: inadvertently left out @amyklobuchar, who also campaigned for Giddens last weekend
author: IsaacDovere

text: Here’s that tweet, screenshotted from before it was deleted:
author: IsaacDovere

text: all those 2020 Democrats who pitched in for that state senate special election (@JohnDelaney, @BetoORourke and @CoryBooker all campaigned and canvassed for him just last weekend) got their win:
author: IsaacDovere

text:
David Sirota was already traveling with Sanders staff by the launch rallies in Brooklyn & Chicago on 3/2 and 3/3, for which he helped write the speeches w/o disclosing. 

Here he is on a deleted tweet on 3/7, looking to undercut @Hickenlooper's launch.
https://www.theatlantic.com/politics/archive/2019/03/sanders-promised-civility-hired-twitter-attack-dog/585259/ …
author: IsaacDovere

text: here's another tweet, deleted last night, in which Bernie Sanders' speechwriter and previously undisclosed adviser, wrote that people who accused him of having motives in digging in on O'Rourke were "deranged and/or running a deliberate disinfo campaign" https://www.theatlantic.com/politics/archive/2019/03/sanders-promised-civility-hired-twitter-attack-dog/585259/ …
author: IsaacDovere

text: The Guardian would seem to be basing this on assurances from Sirota and the Sanders campaign about when Sirota was working for Sanders, which neither disclosed until today as having happened, and which conflict with accounts of people who were familiar with the contact.
author: IsaacDovere

text: Sirota’s attacks on Sanders’ political oppponents under the guise of journalism goes back to 2015 - here’s a story that he wrote about Hillary Clinton (that wasn’t true) which then got picked up by many, including many Republicans, as a line of attack
author: IsaacDovere

text:
Sirota helped write Sanders' launch speeches while calling people who disagreed with his attacks on others "mentally incapacitated." 
I asked Sanders campaign manager @faiz what he made of that, and he said: 
“He used those exact words?... I’m sure he regrets the tone.”
author: IsaacDovere

text: Sanders asked his supporters to “do our very best to engage respectfully with our Democratic opponents―talking about the issues we are fighting for, not about personalities or past grievances. I want to be clear that I condemn bullying & harassment of any kind and in any space.”
author: IsaacDovere

text:
Sirota deleted 20,000 tweets last night after I contacted him about this, including all of the ones in which he has gone after O'Rourke, Biden, Gillibrand, Booker, Harris, Bennet, Hickenlooper and more. 

He said he was doing this as a journalist. Here's a deleted tweet:
author: IsaacDovere

text: SCOOP @davidsirota, just hired as Bernie Sanders' speechwriter and senior adviser, has been quietly writing speeches and advising him for months without disclosing it but while bashing pretty much every candidate in the field:
author: IsaacDovere

text: O'Rourke was asked in Iowa on Friday and said that he doesn't have a position, but that he generally believes that alliances should be strengthened
author: IsaacDovere

text:
O'Rourke is obsessed with The Odyssey (cited again here): https://www.washingtonpost.com/news/style/wp/2019/03/19/feature/are-amy-and-beto-orourke-the-future-of-politics/ …
He likes saying it's about the adventures one man has in his quest to return home to his wife. Most people forget Odysseus turns around & leaves again almost as soon as he gets back to her.
author: IsaacDovere

text:
The Biden team’s concept of choosing a running mate early goes back four years, to when he had Elizabeth Warren over for lunch during his 2015 deliberations. By 2017, they were thinking maybe Kamala Harris. 
Now both would be rivals, but the idea persists:
author: IsaacDovere

text:
in an interview that seems conducted before @BetoORourke jumped in, @ValerieJarrett --who wouldn't usually tip the scales--cites O'Rourke as the only one of the now current 2020 Dems on her list of who makes her excited about the future of politics
https://www.marieclaire.com/career-advice/a26828905/valerie-jarrett-finding-my-voice-interview/ …
author: IsaacDovere

text: Beto O'Rourke is holding a rally in El Paso a week from Saturday. Also that day:
author: IsaacDovere

text: Bernie Sanders joins Kamala Harris and Elizabeth Warren in fundraising off O’Rourke getting in the race:
author: IsaacDovere

text: capturing some of the moments from Iowa over the weekend:
author: IsaacDovere

text: Cuomo, analyzing:
author: IsaacDovere

text: The privilege attacks on @BetoORourke have mostly focused on being a man, but @JulianCastro centers on the white/well to do part:
author: IsaacDovere

text: This ended up being the second biggest event of the weekend - biggest is another @CoryBooker event, a town hall on Sunday night/St. Patrick’s Day going on now in Davenport, with 300+ people
author: IsaacDovere

text: “Bill Clinton & Hillary Clinton, for example, are the modern-day analogues to wicked Ahab and Jezebel. Trump is the  warrior-king Jehu, who took control of the nation and cast idols out of the capital. ‘Jehu also sought to drain the swamp,’ Mr. Cahn said.”
author: IsaacDovere

text:
Maloney also said re 9/11 bill when she wanted to run against Gillibrand:
“Did she author anything of significance?...The 9/11 bill. I worked on that bill for 7 years. 7 and a half years!”
But that was 10 years ago and they have worked together much since
author: IsaacDovere

text: Maloney also said last month of  Gillibrand, “I'm not supporting her because I feel, at this point, I feel that we have to win Ohio and Pennsylvania and Michigan and Wisconsin.”
author: IsaacDovere

text: One of Gillibrand’s House votes that Maloney said in 2009 was a big problem for her with Gillibrand was opposing the bank bailout - that vote is the first one Gillibrand cites in her launch video as an act of bravery
author: IsaacDovere

text: Carolyn Maloney, who for a few months in 2009 was preparing to primary Gillibrand in 2010 on the argument she wasn’t experienced enough and had a bad record in the House and at her law firm, endorses her for president
author: IsaacDovere

text: Biggest event of the weekend in Iowa, of the candidates who came through in the last few days: @CoryBooker, who nearly 300 people out at the Prairie Moon Winery right now in Ames with @JDScholten and @JosephNSanberg
author: IsaacDovere

text: O’Rourke put out another fundraising email, reminding ppl how much he raised in his Senate campaign. But he still hasn’t said how much he’s raised since launching. (Many candidates released first 24 hours numbers, Inslee&Hickenlooper each said they’d raised $1M in first few days)
author: IsaacDovere

text: That’s an article from June 2016, but no reason to let reading get in the way of a rage tweet
author: IsaacDovere

text: the Iowa GOP’s ad airing ahead of the state senate special election that many 2020 Dems have been pitching in on, with pictures of Sanders, Warren and Ocasio-Cortez-Cortez, literally showing the Dem candidate in red and telling people “Reject Socialism”:
author: IsaacDovere

text: Biden’s apparent slip of the tongue on his own presidential plans last night somewhat reminiscent of when he endorsed Clinton in 2016 in a stray remark in a speech at a dinner, ahead of what was supposed to be an official announcement
author: IsaacDovere

text:
Democratic presidential candidate rally schedule next weekend (so far):
-Harris, taking it to O’Rourke in Texas (Houston)
-Sanders, taking it to Harris in San Francisco
-Gillibrand, taking it to Trump at one of his New York properties
author: IsaacDovere

text: This isn’t Trump Tower, but the building in Columbus Circle in New York - the one where Trump took Romney for dinner when he was talking to him about being Secretary of State, and the site of some previous anti-Trump protests
author: IsaacDovere

text: for all the Trump properties that exist and for all the Democratic candidates running, Gillibrand is the first to come up with using one as the backdrop for a political event, now that she is officially in the race
author: IsaacDovere

text:
Clip and save for what is increasingly looking like a coming Biden 2020 stump speech:
"We choose hope over fear. We choose unity over division. And we choose truth over lies. It matters. Folks, it’s still our century.”
author: IsaacDovere

text: "We’re literally in a battle for the soul of America, & an overwhelming need to restore the backbone of America," Biden says, now tantalizing people w/o it being a slip."It’s not about me and whether I run or not, I mean that sincerely. It’s about the capacity to restore America"
author: IsaacDovere

text: Biden says he wants to talk about a new corporate ethics, and though not at length tonight, "you're going to hear a whole hell of a lot more about it from me."
author: IsaacDovere

text: Biden often tells a story about a conversation with Xi Jingping in which the Chinese leader asked him to define America in one word. He usually says he said, "Possibilities." Tonight, as he's telling it, he says it was "Promise."
author: IsaacDovere

text: Trump doesn't believe in shared American values, Biden says. "He thinks they make us weak. He thinks we're suckers. He's dead wrong. He doesn't understand that it's these values that make us strong."
author: IsaacDovere

text: Biden slips: "I have the most progressive record of anybody running--anybody who *would* run. I didn’t mean it."
author: IsaacDovere

text:
Not to be outdone, @JohnCarneyDE:
"He doesn't just look like he's back. He looks like he's ready for a fight. At a time when the country is being torn apart, into fragments of what it should be, here comes our Joe Biden."
author: IsaacDovere

text: .@ChrisCoons, going even further than he usually does in Biden 2020-pumping at Delaware Dems dinner tonight in Dover: "I am praying for that man, and I am excited to hear from him … He has shaped history. He's not just a great speechmaker, he's a great change-maker."
author: IsaacDovere

text:
.@amyklobuchar to @chucktodd on O’Rourke and being “born” to run:
“When I was growing up, in high school, that's not what girls thought they were going to do.... I don't think many people thought a girl could be president. I wasn't born to run. But I am running.”
author: IsaacDovere

text: .@amyklobuchar greets the kitchen staff as she arrives at a Pizza Ranch for what is apparently the first event of the 2020 cycle to take place in Independence, Iowa
author: IsaacDovere

text: I asked O'Rourke if, three days in to his campaign, he still feels born to do this, as he told Vanity Fair:
author: IsaacDovere

text: O'Rourke told @chucktodd in Waterloo he wouldn't be running for pres if he'd won in TX, but "I have an opportunity now to do something that I think the country badly needs--or maybe I should put it this way: I have the oppty to be part of something that the country badly needs."
author: IsaacDovere

text:
2 candidates jousting to show mass appeal now doing rallies ahead of O'Rourke's in El Paso on 3/30:
-Harris will rally in Houston, in O'Rourke's home state of Texas next Saturday
-Sanders will rally in CA, in San Diego on Friday and in Harris' home town of San Francisco on Sunday
author: IsaacDovere

text: irony: @JoaquinCastrotx had told some people in 2017 that he didn't run for Senate in part to not get in the way of his brother's presidential plans, which was what cleared the way for @BetoORourke to come in and now potentially overshadow @JulianCastro
author: IsaacDovere

text: in which one Castro brother appears to not so subtly confirm political rumors about the other Castro brother:
author: IsaacDovere

text: O'Rourke launched just after his party struggled with divisions over the remarks of Ilhan Omar, and as announced 2020 Dems tried to thread their own responses about Omar & the Israeli-Palestinian conflict. Asked him just now for his thoughts, given his unity pitch. Full answer:
author: IsaacDovere

text:
advantage of being a candidate whose name is already a brand: people will show up w/merchandise for sale at events, like here in Waterloo for O’Rourke

disadvantage: some union members who came to this event are blaming him for T-shirts being made in Honduras, tho they’re not his
author: IsaacDovere

text: Here’s the player piano song roll box O’Rourke was asked to sign Friday at the Sing a Long bar in Mt. Vernon, Iowa - “Happy Days Are Here Again” was the proprietor’s choice:
author: IsaacDovere

text:
O'Rourke said when he was first running for Congress that he was against Obamacare. He said during his Senate campaign he backs for a Medicare for All-type program of single payer health insurance. 

He was asked yesterday in Iowa if he still supports single payer:
author: IsaacDovere

text:
on impeaching Trump, which he previously said he supported:
“I’m not asking Congress to do one thing or the other,” he said. “You’re asking me, ‘Has the president committed impeachable offenses?’ Yes. Period.”

Explaining his previous support:
author: IsaacDovere

text: O'Rourke's full answer when asked if he supports fuel with 10% or 15% ethanol (the woman who asked said she's fine with the answer, figuring he can't take a firm position because he's "from oil country," but she'd want more specifics from other candidates):
author: IsaacDovere

text:
O'Rourke is choosing not to say much firm about his positions on ethanol, health care, immigration, reproductive rights, impeachment or other issues.

But the people in Iowa who are showing up like how he's saying it. 

My story from northeast Iowa:
author: IsaacDovere

text:
in Washington, Iowa, @BetoORourke is asked again on whether he will be releasing his fundraising numbers for what's come in since he launched. 
"I can't," he said. 
You could, I pointed out. 
"You're right - I choose not to," he said.
author: IsaacDovere
